task-wr.title: Changing the Hyper-threading Status
task-wr.shortdesc: The hyper-threading status is controlled by the BIOS settings of the host.

step.cmd: Edit the host BIOS settings to enable or disable hyper-threading.

info.p:
For more about editing the BIOS, refer to the documentation provided by the maker of the host computer. CGTS-3047 adds note
Changes to the host BIOS must be made while it is locked and the host must not be subsequently unlocked until it comes back online (locked-disabled-online), when the Inventory would have the updated Hyperthreading settings.

substep.cmd: Boot the host in BIOS mode.
Update the host BIOS settings to enable or disable hyper-threading.
To apply the changes, allow the host to boot to a locked state with the updated hyper-threading settings.

step.cmd: Confirm the hyper-threading status in Titanium Server.

info.p: The hyper-threading status is reported on the Processor tab for the host. For more information, see .
